result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earvin Antwan Wright

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earvin Antwan Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status following 21CF4458. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earvin Antwan Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status following 21CF4458. Matter is adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earvin Antwan Wright appeared by video. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Following case #21CF4458. Matter is adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,500.00. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. 24 hour curfew with the exception of verified medical, court and legal appointments. Court ordered no possession or caring of any animals.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp. 12/9/22
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.S.A. or E.A.M.

Defendant Earvin Antwan Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Earvin Antwan Wright.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
